item.title: Tesla profits slumped 46% last year, as it lost its crown as the top EV seller
item.description: The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.

item.title: Amazon slashes another 16,000 jobs
item.description: Amazon just cut 16,000 employees, adding to 14,000 positions eliminated in October. We explore the driving forces behind these layoffs, and the broader trend in tech that it's a part of.

item.title: Fed holds interest rates steady, taking a pause from rate cuts to assess the economy
item.description: The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautious about additional rate cuts.

item.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
item.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

item.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

item.title: A crackdown on immigration is leading to a sharp drop in U.S. population growth
item.description: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in the year ending last June as it did the previous year.

item.title: How did Tucker Carlson become one of the far right's most influential voices?
item.description: Writer Jason Zengerle says Carlson had the foresight to see Trump's potential in 2015. Now he's someone the president "definitely listens to." Zengerle's new book is Hated by All the Right People.

item.title: India and the EU clinch the 'mother of all deals' in a historic trade agreement
item.description: India and the European Union have reached a free trade agreement, at a time when Washington targets them both with steep import tariffs, pushing major economies to seek alternate partnerships.

item.title: After rocky start, Bari Weiss plans cuts, adds commentators at CBS News
item.description: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss came in with a mandate to reshape coverage. She laid out her strategy in a staff meeting Tuesday.
